duties_responsibilities.duty: Leads all aspects of the company’s safety culture and creates awareness by demonstrating commitment to an injury-free environment through individual actions and mentoring others.
Manages and oversees company staff, subcontractors, suppliers, and programs such as Safety, Quality, and EEOC for a small project or a major portion of a larger project.
Develops work plans for subcontractors and self-performed work.
Coordinates and manages the care, custody, and control of the project site.
Attends, manages, and participates in appropriate progress and/or project OAC meetings.
Communicates key project information to owners, design team, governing authorities, subcontractors, suppliers, and other departments.
Supports the project closeouts by supervising pre-punch activities and coordinating activities with the owner, architect, and governing authorities.
Participates with field operations leadership and the project team to put together a project pre plan; implements, monitors, and adjusts as needed throughout the project lifecycle.
Understands and applies the terms and conditions of the owner and subcontractor contracts for the project.
Leads, supports, and promotes a culture of diversity and inclusion within the organization.
Manages the largest, most complex stand-alone and/or multiple complex projects from initial planning to completion.
Provides management and/or oversight to multiple projects and project teams.
Provides input, leads, and executes company and regional key strategic initiatives.
Delivers leadership messages to multiple audiences both internally and externally.
Coordinates field staffing and project changes.
Participates in project buy-out meetings with subcontractors and vendors.
Responsible for identifying and recruiting top talent.
Manages the timecard approval process and ensures reporting of accurate hours and proper cost codes.
Gains understanding of the project pursuit process and methodology.
Participates in the negotiation process with the owner and architect to gain agreement for project changes.
Responsible for document changes and impact on the project schedule.
Leads various meetings including daily stand-up and weekly trade meetings.
Updates drawings, logs, diaries, and inspection notebooks.
Manages material and equipment needs for the project.
Supports the Material and Other Costs (MOC) and Dunn Logistics Service Center (DLSC) procurement and approval processes.
Evaluates progress on self-perform work and makes adjustments as needed.
Manages timecard approval process to ensure reporting of accurate hours and proper cost codes.
Partners with project management to identify schedule and costs associated with project changes.
Participates with the project team in preparation and presentation for all project review meetings, including the monthly review process and other key project meetings.
Understands JE Dunn’s policy of non-discrimination and ensures positive, proactive implementation throughout the organization.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in construction management, engineering, or related field (Preferred). In lieu of the above requirements, equivalent relevant experience will be considered.
